description.narrative: Strategic Results Partnerships, and Innovation for accelerating delivery of top quality programmatic results for the SDGs and organizational efficiency and effectiveness for program delivery

1.1 Program board meetings 1.2. CO Annual Business Plan development 1.3 Approval status of Annual Work Plan 1.4 Revision of AWP tracking 1.5 CPD and SP alignment 2.1 Updates on Project quality assurance 2.2 Projects to be closed 2.3 Review Programme SOPs 2.4 Implementation of capacity building plans 2.5. Risk Logs 2.6 Issue Logs 3.1 Evaluation plan and management response implementation 3.2 Status of M&E Annual plan 3.3 Indicator methodological sheets 3.4 Monitoring visits 3.5 IWP progress updated as per result tracker 3.6 Conduct review meetings 4.1 Result Oriented Annual Reporting 4.2 CO Annual Report 4.3 Approved Annual Progress Report submitted 4.4 Review semiannual report submitted by projects 4.5 Updated ATLAS project mg module along with results and finalize IATI 4.6 Update donor report tracking tool

comment.narrative:
1. Strategic planning and programming for delivery of results (PLANNING) strengthened 1.1. By the end of each quarter in 2020 , all projects Atlas Mgt Module are updated 1.2. By the end of 2020, all the CPD outcomes and outputs annual milestones are updated 1.3. By the end of first quarter all steps of Annual buisness plan 2020 is completed and endorsed . 2: Quality of Country Programme and projects strengthened to support in high performance and programme delivery (QUALITY ASSURANCE) 2.1. By the end of 2020 Q2, all new, implemnetation and closure QA are updated in the system 2.2. By the end of 2020 quarter 2, Standard Operational Procedures for program planning, QA and reporting in line new CPD 2018-2022 updated. All relevant staffs trained and ensure effective implementation 2.3. By the end of each quarter in 2020 all KPI indicators for planning, M&E, Reporting are tracked and monitored
3: Strengthen Integrated Programme through strong Monitoring & Evaluation system/RBM support (MONITORING, EVALUATION, AUDIT) 3.1. By the end of 2020 Quarter 2, M&E plans are reviewed, finalized and approved with clear indicators, source and capacities in place for implementation. Monthly discussion and review organized with projects led by programme team 3.2. By the end of every Quarter of 2020, Evaluation Plan is tracked and management response of evaluations monitored 3.3. By the end of 2020 quarter 3, a tracking system and tools in place for key result monitoring 3.4. By the end of 2020, key M&E focal points are trained in basic M&E system 3.5. By the end of 2020, ensure that all new projects formulated are of Gen 2 and have specific reporting on gender indicators.
4: Strengthen evidence based performance reporting and ensure compliance with corporate and donor reporting requirements (REPORTING) 4.1. By the end of 2020, all projects are reporting APRs, QPRs and BTORs as per corporate and Co standards. 4.2. By the end of 2020, ensure that all projects report to donor as per reporting calendar
5: Establish new partnerships for programme implementation and resource mobilisation 5.1. CO resource mobilisation target achieved 5.2. By end 2020, 1-2 "triple win" partnerships with private sector secured
6: Identify innovations and support projects and programme teams to integrate organizational knowledge and innovation approaches into their work 6.1. By end 2020, 2-3 projects effectively use innovative data collection and analytical tools for monitoring and adaptive management 6.2. A public-sector innovation lab to identify new ways of addressing development challenges established with private sector support 6.3. By end 2020, 1-2 flagship innovative development solutions successfully implemented
7: Deliver country office visibility and effective internal and external communications at all levels 7.1. UNDP programme areas/activities gain media traction and start to have brand recognition 7.2. Volume to UNDP website and blogs increases by 25% 7.3. UNDP changes the way we communicate (3-5 criteria for strategic communications fulfilled)

UNDP programme areas/activities gain media attraction and start to have brand recognition

By the end of quarter 2, projects are linked with new program tree and Atlas Mgt Module are updated By the end of quarter 2, all the CPD outcomes and outputs are linked with strategic plan with baseline and milestones By the end of quarter all steps of Annual business plan 2018 is completed and endorsed. By the end of 2018, all ongoing projects have at least satisfactory QA ratings By the end of quarter 2, Standard Operational Procedures for program planning, QA and reporting in line new CPD 2018-2022 developed. All relevant staffs trained and ensure effective implementation By the end of each quarter all KPI indicators for planning, M&E, Reporting are tracked and monitored By the end of 2018, all 10 projects closure QA is done as per corporate requirements. By the end of Quarter 3, M&E system mapping carried out and develop M&E system for CPD 2018-2022 By the end of Quarter 2, Evaluation Plan uploaded, tracked and management response of evaluations monitored By the end of Quarter 3, at least four projects M&E frameworks with clear indicators, source and capacities in place for implementation. Monthly discussion and review organized with projects led by programme team By the end of quarter 3, a tracking system and tools in place for key result monitoring By the end of 2018, key M&E focal points are trained in basic M&E system By the end of 2018, ensure that all new projects formulated are of Gen 2 and have specific reporting on gender indicators. 3.1. By the end of 2018, a standard reporting for APRs, QPRs and BTORs in practice By the end of 2018, a standard reporting for APRs, QPRs and BTORs in practice By the end of 2018, ensure that all projects report to donor as per reporting calendar CO resource mobilisation target achieved 1-3 UNDP programme areas/activities gain media traction and start to have brand recognition Volume to UNDP website and blogs increases by 25% UNDP changes the way we communicate (3-5 criteria for strategic communications fulfilled)

1. Strengthen strategic planning and programming for delivery of results  Formulate CPD Program tree architecture and completed all corporate requirements for Program tree setup for new program cycle after analyzing ongoing projects. Code book with ATLAS output and activities are prepared for projects to ensure standardization.  Implements corporate initiatives and tools, such as the alignment process, Integrated Results and Resource Framework (IRRF) BMT exercise; Align CPD results with Strategic Plan 2018-2021; Link ATLAS project output to CPD outputs.  Contributes to Country office Annual Business Plan (ABP) 2018 development processes working with the Programme Support unit, and programme units. Take lead in finalizing Annual business plan - Integrated workplan 2018 Results Areas and Enabling Actions.  Support in preparation of Project Annual Workplan (AWP) 2018 completed on time with sufficient consultation, consistency and in line with approved project documents; Contribute in the AWP review to ensure that it is in line with approved project documents, multiyear work plan, result and resource framework and corporate standards. Developed AWP preparation guideline for projects. Developed AWP review checklist for the reviewers – Program, SMU and PFU.  Provide strategic inputs in project design especially in results formulation and RRF for new projects. Ensure right results are reflected as mentioned in TOC for 6 new projects designed in 2018. Strategic advice provided in setting up result monitoring system, data base and result monitoring plans according to Project document and RRF.
2. Quality of Country Programme and projects strengthened to support in high performance and programme delivery and facilitate in knowledge building  Ensure Quality assurance of programme and projects at design, implementation and closure phase. Keep logbook on status and action plan to improve the quality of programming in 7 quality standards. Reviewed, analysed and verified status of 17 Projects Design and implementation QA. Initiate closure QA for 11 projects. Support the project in development of management response. Provided orientation to the project staffs on Quality assurance process in design, implementation and closure phases.  Align country office program Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) in line with new revised POPP. Reviewed New POPP changes and ensure that CO SOPs are in line. Provided briefing session on key changes in POPP in Program Management Team. Developed 11 SOPs for key programming process like Project design; LPAC, Quality assurance; Annual work planning; Project Board meetings; Results Reporting: Project closure; Project and program Monitoring; Evaluation. Required guidelines, templates and tools are developed for implementation of each SOP. Ensure projects are following corporate/country office SOPs. Provide advisory support to the project team on programming, quality assurance, M&E and Reporting.  Quality assurance of corporate platforms like Corporate planning platform; Atlas project management module and IATI dashboard. Ensure that project information in UNDP’s result management system including ATLAS project management module is updated quarterly and reflect change and modifications.  Develop oversight framework with Key Performance Indicator (KPI) for senior management/MIT. Regular tracking and reporting progress especially on KPIs of program planning, monitoring/evaluations and reporting especially in PMT meetings.  Mentors and develops capacities of national staff in quality assurance, monitoring, evaluation and reporting. Trains CO and project staff as well as partners on use of corporate and other relevant M&E, QA and reporting tools and methodologies, including RBM. Developed and Roll out capacity building plan for program and projects.
3. Strengthen Integrated Programme through strong Monitoring & Evaluation system/RBM support  Play active role in Annual result review of UNDAF and CPD results in Annual Programme board meetings. Take lead in preparing key results, lesson learned and issues for Annual programme board meeting to donors, government counterparts.  M&E system mapping of 12 key components of functional M&E system carried out. Based on the analysis leads in design of CPD 2018-2022 M&E system for country office that include M&E strategy, M&E Plan, Tools and M&E assurance system. Drafted 7 chapters of M&E guideline for country office.  Finalize and upload CPD 2018-2022 evaluation plan by assuring quality, costing, compliance and implementation for learning and programme effectiveness. Ensures quality of CPD evaluation plan, costing, compliance and implementation to ensure strategic, robust, timely, and relevant evaluation for learning and programme effectiveness; Support in evaluation as evaluation focal point- formulating inputs for TOR, facilitating organization and implementation of missions and support in review/finalization of reports. Coordinates responses to evaluation findings and recommendations and ensures that they are recorded and monitored in the Evaluation Resource Center (ERC); Identifies, documents and shares lessons learned from evaluation findings; Reviews and approves all terms of reference for project and programme mid-term reviews, evaluations and assessments. Reviews final draft evaluation reports and mid-term reviews for quality assurance and provides inputs prior to finalization.  Support projects to establish 12 key M&E components. (1) Theory of Change (2) M&E Frameworks of each project with Baseline target and Indicators (3) Annual M&E Plan (4) Evaluation Plan (5) Indicator Methodological Notes (6) M&E assurance system with roles/responsibilities and review meetings (7) M&E Budget (8) Project specific M&E tools (9) MIS Database (10) Result Review meeting (11) Reporting system (12) Knowledge Management Communication and Learning.  Quality assures CO data collection strategies to ensure the right balance of qualitative and quantitative evidence and advises on data analysis to assess programme results, improve programme quality and inform future decision-making processes allowing for reporting against Country Programme document, projects and other corporate reporting.  Support project in developing project level tools and formats for data collection and verification. Plan and coordinate monitoring activities including field visits.
4. Strengthen evidence-based performance reporting and ensure compliance with corporate and donor reporting requirements  Maintains calendar of all corporate and donor reporting requirements including programme and project, keeps staff informed, manages staff inputs and consolidates and quality checks before dissemination of reports working with DCD for approval; Monitors project/programme compliance with corporate and donor reporting requirements, reviews project reports prior to dissemination.  Prepared reporting templates with guidelines - Quarterly reporting templates with guidelines; Semiannual reporting templates with guidelines; Annual reporting templates with guidelines; Project completion report template with guidelines; Back to Office reporting templates; Field office quarterly reporting templates; Field Trip Planning template; Event Monitoring Report template.  Support communication team in preparing UNDP Annual report by providing key results for 2017. Provided “Results by number “from system and from 5 ROAR reports (2013-2017) for CO 5-year progress report. Provided key results from output board reports for 2017 Annual report.  Take lead in preparing key results, lesson learned and issues for Annual programme board meeting: Reviewed output board reports and Extracted key results for 2017 for programme board meeting.  Manages all corporate, bureau and RCO reporting requirements including ROAR. Take lead in Result oriented annual report 2018 report. Review quarterly project reports and ensure results in line with Project Annual M&E Plan and Integrated workplan priorities.  Support the projects in preparation and finalizing Donor reports, Semiannual results report (6) Annual Progress reports (11) and Project completion reports (9) in 2018.

1: Strategic planning and programming for delivery of results (PLANNING) strengthened 1.1. By the end of each quarter in 2019 , all projects Atlas Mgt Module are updated 1.2. By the end of 2019 quarter 1, all the CPD outcomes and outputs annual milestones are updated 1.3. By the end of first quarter all steps of Annual buisness plan 2019 is completed and endorsed. 2: Quality of Country Programme and projects strengthened to support in high performance and programme delivery (QUALITY ASSURANCE) 2.1. By the end of 2019 Q2, all new and closrue QA are updated in the system 2.2. By the end of 2019 quarter 2, Standard Operational Procedures for program planning, QA and reporting in line new CPD 2018-2022 updated. All relevant staffs trained and ensure effective implementation 2.3. By the end of each quarter in 2019 all KPI indicators for planning, M&E, Reporting are tracked and monitored 3: Strengthen Integrated Programme through strong Monitoring & Evaluation system/RBM support (MONITORING, EVALUATION, AUDIT) 3.1. By the end of 2019 Quarter 2, M&E plans are reviewed, finalized and approved with clear indicators, source and capacities in place for implementation. Monthly discussion and review organized with projects led by programme team 3.2. By the end of every Quarter of 2019, Evaluation Plan is tracked and management response of evaluations monitored 3.3. By the end of 2019 quarter 3, a tracking system and tools in place for key result monitoring 3.4. By the end of 2019, key M&E focal points are trained in basic M&E system 3.5. By the end of 2019, ensure that all new projects formulated are of Gen 2 and have specific reporting on gender indicator 4: Strengthen evidence based performance reporting and ensure compliance with corporate and donor reporting requirements (REPORTING) 4.1. By the end of 2019, all projects are reporting APRs, QPRs and BTORs as per corporate and Co standards. 4.2. By the end of 2019, ensure that all projects report to donor as per reporting calendar 5: Establish new partnerships for programme implementation and resource mobilisation 5.1. 70% of action points in Partnership and Communications Action Plan implemented 5.2. By end 2019, 1-2 partnerships with private sector secured 6: Identify innovations and support projects and programme teams to integrate organizational knowledge and innovation approaches into their work 6.1. By end 2019, 1-2 projects effectively use innovative data collection and analytical tools for result monitoring 6.2. By end 2019, 1-2 flagship innovative development solutions successfully implemented 7: Deliver country office visibility and effective internal and extenal communications at all levels 7.1. 1-3 UNDP programme areas/activities gain media traction and start to have brand recognition 7.2. Volume to UNDP website and blogs increases by 25% 7.3. UNDP changes the way we communicate (3-5 criteria for strategic communications fulfilled)

1: Strategic planning and programming for delivery of results (PLANNING) strengthened 1.1. In 2019, atlas project management training was conducted 4 times for the existing and newly joined programme staff and support the projects to update the atlas project. The status of the projects is updated in the regular Programme Management Meeting for necessary action 1.2. By the end of 2019 quarter 1, all the CPD outcomes and outputs annual milestones are updated 1.3. 2019 Annual business plan 2019 is completed and endorsed according to the set timeline
2: Quality of Country Programme and projects strengthened to support in high performance and programme delivery (QUALITY ASSURANCE) 2.1. By the end of 2019 Q2, all new and closure QA are updated in the system 2.2. Newly joined program staff are trained on QA to enhance their capacity to conduct QA for the projects under their respective programme. By the end of 2019 quarter 2, Standard Operational Procedures for program planning, QA and reporting in line new CPD 2018-2022 updated. All relevant staffs trained and ensure effective implementation 2.3. KPI indicators for planning, M&E, Reporting are tracked and discussed at the Management Integrated team meeting.
3: Strengthen Integrated Programme through strong Monitoring & Evaluation system/RBM support (MONITORING, EVALUATION, AUDIT) 3.1. Integrated project M&E plans are reviewed, finalized and approved with clear indicators, source and capacities in place for implementation. Monthly discussion and review organized with projects led by programme team 3.2. Three evaluations have been conducted and CO Evaluation Plan is tracked and management response of evaluations monitored regularly 3.3. Result indicators are tracked and monitored and visualized by using Sapphire data base system and power Bi and shared at the project board meetings, donor meeting and reports 3.4. RBM Technical Working Group is formed with each RBM points from project and meet monthly to discuss and update on the M& E system. 3.5. Project indicators have been reviewed and revised to ensure gender responsive and ensure that all new projects formulated are of Gen 2 and have specific reporting on gender indicator
4: Strengthen evidence based performance reporting and ensure compliance with corporate and donor reporting requirements (REPORTING) 4.1. All projects are reporting APRs, QPRs and BTORs as per corporate and CO standards. 4.2. All projects report to donor as per reporting calendar
5.1 Partnership and communication action plan drafted but not yet finalized. More than 80% of action points are implemented in terms of Communication action plan. 5.2. One partnership with private sector – Ooredoo and one partnership with individual donor was secured.
6.1 An app-based Online Case Information System for the Supreme Court was piloted as innovative data collection and analysis tool, which can solve a critical information gap by providing real-time information on court cases filed in the lower courts, and also the ability to quickly query the data. 6.2. Digital Innovation and Entrepreneurship Hub launch in October as joint Ooredoo-UNDP partnership initiative. The Hackathon is a special initiative of the UNDP and Ooredoo to promote and scale up digital innovation and entrepreneurship amongst the youth in Myanmar. UN agencies (WFP, UNOPS, FAO) supported the event as judges, facilitators and mentors. 7: Deliver country office visibility and effective internal and external communications at all levels For Twitter, 190 Tweets have been posted and 752 mention, 9 k new followers, 22k profile visit and 6 Million tweet impression Facebook 1.7 Million followers and likes You tube 115 subscribers, with 4.7 K views with 321 /K impressions For website, user 50 k with 139k reviews

Number of steps of Annual business plan 2021 completed and endorsed by end Q1 (target: all) 2.1 Keep track of 10+10 COBP indicators and update quarterly to ensure the high performance of CO 9 (target: all ) 2.2 Number of new Design, implementation and closure QA are updated in the system by end Q4 (target: all) 3.1. By the end of every Quarter of 2021, Evaluation Plan is tracked and management response of evaluations monitored 3.3. Number of projects applying Power BI for monitoring purposes (Baseline: 1, Target: 6) 3.4. Number of projects reporting APRs, QPRs and BTORs as per corporate and CO standards (target: all) 4.2. Number of projects report to donor as per reporting calendar (target: all) 5.1. Relevant, cross functional and CO-wide management priorities are met (target: all) 6.1. Number of comprehensive, CO wide, programme risk management framework in place. (Baseline: 0, Target: 1) 6.2. Development projects keep track of the risk and updated the management and status regularly. (target all) 7.1. Number of new private sector partnerships forged to support the acceleration of the CPD (Baseline: 0, Target: 2) 10.1. Number of UNDP programme areas/activities gain media traction and start to have brand recognition (target: 1-3 10.2. Volume to UNDP website and blogs increased. (target: 25%) 10.3.
